tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE vm_configuration ( 
    vm_id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
    vm_name VARCHAR(255), 
    vm_memory_gb INT, 
    vm_cpu_cores INT, 
    vm_os VARCHAR(50) 
);

CREATE TABLE vm_network (
    network_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    vm_id INT,
    network_name VARCHAR(255),
    subnet_mask VARCHAR(255),
    gateway VARCHAR(255),
    FOREIGN KEY (vm_id) REFERENCES vm_config(vm_id)
);

CREATE TABLE VirtualMachines (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    ip_address VARCHAR(15) NOT NULL,
    os_version VARCHAR(50),
    memory_gb INT,
    storage_gb INT
);

CREATE TABLE VMConfigurations (
    config_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    vm_id UUID REFERENCES VirtualMachines(id),
    cpu_cores INT,
    ram_gb INT,
    storage_type VARCHAR(20),
    storage_capacity_gb INT
);

CREATE TABLE configurations (
    config_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    vm_id INT,
    config_name VARCHAR(255),
    config_value TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (vm_id) REFERENCES virtual_machines(vm_id)
);

CREATE TABLE virtual_machines (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    vm_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    vm_os VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    vm_memory_mb INT NOT NULL,
    vm_cpu_cores INT NOT NULL
);
